hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Liquidity Rotation on BTC Dominance Rejection at Key Level
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, if BTC Dominance (BTCD) rallies to test the 54.5-55.5% resistance zone but fails to close above 55% on a weekly basis, capital will rotate into high-liquidity large-cap altcoins (ETH, SOL) within 48 hours, generating alpha via a long altcoin/BTC pair trade.
hypothesis_content.rationale: The 'structural shift' in liquidity post-crash makes sustained, dominant BTC rallies less likely as the market seeks beta. The 54.5-55.5% zone is a major historical inflection point for BTCD. A rejection here signals failed safe-haven concentration and triggers a rotational search for yield into the next most liquid assets (ETH, SOL), especially if they are relatively oversold. Neutral funding prevents a squeeze-driven false start.
entry_conditions: BTCD fails to achieve a weekly close > 55%
ETH/BTC or SOL/BTC pair is at or below its 30-day low
Aggregate altcoin perpetual funding rates are neutral or slightly negative (<= 0.01%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: ALT/BTC pair gains 8% from entry, OR BTCD breaks down below 52.5%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTCD achieves a daily close > 55.5% (resistance break invalidated)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: BTC Dominance breaks and holds above 55.5%, continuing its climb despite the NEUTRAL regime, indicating a risk-off consolidation within crypto itself, negating the rotation thesis.
